definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
"house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: You insult the Queen of Burgund in public with these lies?
sentences.chinese: 你居然在大庭广众下用这种谎言侮辱勃艮的皇后？

sentences.english: He cut a poor figure on a public occasion.
sentences.chinese: 他在大庭广众中大出洋相。

sentences.english: When he started undressing in public I didn't know where to look.
sentences.chinese: 他在大庭广众之下脱衣服，我感到很难为情。

sentences.english: Good Loving Do not smooch in the company of others.
sentences.chinese: 得体示爱在大庭广众之下，别搂抱亲吻个不停。

sentences.english: The poet ranted his humorous verses before a big crowd.
sentences.chinese: 这位诗人在大庭广众之下大声朗诵他的幽默诗句。

sentences.english: The determination not to weep in public.
sentences.chinese: 决心不在大庭广众下哭泣。

sentences.english: To think he should say that in public.
sentences.chinese: 没想到，他会在大庭广众这么说。

sentences.english: These kids ought to feel ashamed of themselves for such a free-for-all in public.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子在大庭广众这样大吵大闹真是该感到害臊。

sentences.english: Wearing the right clothes for running may make you feel more comfortable when running in public.
sentences.chinese: 穿上合适的衣服去大庭广众下跑步会让你感到舒服些。

sentences.english: A large crowd of people gathered to watch her.
sentences.chinese: 一个人驻足观看她的大庭广众。

sentences.english: Say somebody does pick on you in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人老爱在大庭广众之下挑你的刺。

definition: see 萬目睽睽|万目睽睽[wan4 mu4 kui2 kui2]
the full light of day (idiom)/fig. peace and prosperity/in broad daylight
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
in broad daylight/in the middle of the day/KMT emblem, a white sun on a blue background
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
in front of/in the presence of
in the middle of the street/facing the street
